resources.string: Select cryptos to rebalance or monitor
Periodic rebalancing check won\'t occur until you validate records!
Please, configure the keys in Binance as READ ONLY!
Every how many MINUTES check whether should rebalance. Doing it often may drain your battery faster.
To have no impact on your battery the interval won\'t be exact, but close to the value you select. So IT IS NORMAL if the real check is performed some minutes after or before the selected interval.
By what percent ANY COIN INITIAL ALLOCATION have to go up/down for you to get notified. We threat the coins that you added in the main page as your whole portfolio even if you have other coins.

Suppose you have 30% BTC and 70% ETH of your total portfolio, and you put 10 in the setting below. Some day BTC went up and now above 33% of your whole portfolio. BTC went up by more than 10% of it\'s initial allocation so you will get notified.
Let\'s do a quick brief on how to configure and use Bianic.
Remember: you can always get back here by clicking on the three dots and then Guide button at the top right corner of the main page.
Go to the configuration page. The only required thing here is to paste your Binance API and Secret keys. You can also read there how to generate them in Binance.
Please configure the keys in Binance as Read Only. We don\'t need any other permission and it\'s in your interests to secure your account.
After Pasting the keys scroll down and click on the Save button.
We will discuss other configuration options as we dive deeper.
That\'s all, now you can start using Bianic. Next we show what you can do.

In the Main Page, you select coins and their allocation percent. This data will be used in other features of the app. Of course you don\'t have to put here all the coins you have in the portfolio, only those you want Bianic to work with.
Bianic works only with cryptos in the Spot Wallet. It won\'t recognize or use coins outside of your Spot Wallet.
After selecting click on Save button. Then click on Validate Records, to check whether Bianic can work with the coins you inserted. When records are valid you may continue.

Enter the reports page. You can click on Generate Report button, and you will see a new record appears. You can click on Details to view it. You can see each coin\'s price, the amount and how many in USD you had of that coin at the report generation moment.

You can also view other parameters relevant to rebalancing. You can see the initial allocation you put for the coins in the main page and the current allocation. You can see how many coins you need to buy or sell to return to the initial allocation.
We keep only 30 reports. After exceeding this amount old reports are deleted.

You can do Time Rebalancing that way. You can enter Bianic every hour/day/week, generate a report and view how many coins you need to buy or sell. Then you just go to Binance and perform the trades and you are done!
If you have the Binance app, you usually can do it in around a minute!
In the configuration page, set the Threshold Rebalance Percent you want to rebalance on.
On report generation, if any coin deviated by the threshold you set, the report\'s color will be green and it will tell you that deviation occurred.
You can click on Generate Report button and view whether the threshold was reached every some hours or minutes of course.
But we strongly recommend to use our Live Coin Watch feature instead.
Key feature of Bianic. Set in the configuration page the Validation Interval and click on the Activate button. Then click Save.
You will see a notification that tells you that Bianic performs validation\'s in background, with the last validation time if any performed.
In background, Bianic will check every Validation Interval minutes whether any coin reached the threshold you put in the configuration.
If so, it will notify you about it and will generate a report at the moment.
So you can let Bianic monitor your coins, and it will tell you when threshold rebalancing is possible.
We communicate with you via notifications. Notice the notification\'s colors: green means rebalancing available, orange-red that some exception occurred.
Pro Tip #1: Manage what notifications are shown to you using android\'s notification channels feature.
Pro Tip #2: Click on notification to be taken to the relevant page.
After reboot, Live Coin Watch will turn on if was activated before. Just give it some minutes.
To stop the Live Coin Watch just enter the configuration page, click on the Deactivate button and then click Save.

Sometimes problems occur. You have no internet, pasted the wrong API key or any other possible issue. Exceptions Log feature is here to notify you when such things happen and to help you understand and fix the problems by yourself.
When any problem occurs, we notify you using orange-red notification. We also save it so you can enter Bianic, enter the Exceptions page and see what happened.
Normal Exception: Fixable issue that we predicted that may occur to you. For example no internet connection while Live Coin Watch is trying to retrieve information from Binance.
Critical Exception: Problem that we didn\'t expect to ever happen.
Fatal Exception: Problem saving other exceptions.

Usually, you encounter Normal Exceptions. They will often come with an indicative message about what was the cause. Their aim is to basically ask you to do some action, or fix something so Bianic can continue doing it\'s job.
If you encounter an issue that you can\'t fix or don\'t understand what happened, please contact us using the About and then Get Help buttons in the Main Page.
We ask you to write us once you encounter any Critical or Fatal exceptions, as you shouldn\'t see them at all. That way we can keep improving Bianic.
We keep only 30 exceptions. After exceeding this amount old exceptions are deleted.
Pro Tip #1: Different exception types have different colors. In the Exceptions page they can be yellow-orange-red. Also they have different orange-red types of color\'s in the notifications.
Pro Tip #2: 99% of Exceptions occur because you have no network, slow network, wrong Binance keys or didn\'t setup the cryptos in the Main Page correctly.
Failed validating records. View exception for details.

The permissions we will ask for are crucial for the normal operation of the app. The battery one to continue doing our job in power saving mode. The notifications to run in background & communicate with you.
Checking with Binance whether the records are valid. Wait a moment please.
Dear investor, let\'s get to work.
Can\'t validate records while editing record
Dot cannot be first character in allocation
Dot cannot be last character in allocation
up to 2 digits after dot in allocation
Symbol must contain only alphanumeric characters
Generating report. Wait a moment please.
Click on \'Validate Records\' button in main page

Storing the keys on your device in Bianic is safe because you should configure them as READ ONLY in Binance. Don\'t ever change the fact that they are read-only after showing it to Bianic. We are not responsible for any issues, trades or losses occurred because of not following this simple rule. We are not responsible for your losses in general - Bianic is a tool to help you and make your adventure easier, not an investment/trading advisor.
Api key must contain alphanumeric characters
Secret key must contain alphanumeric characters
Threshold rebalancing percent - cannot be empty
Threshold rebalancing percent - value must be less than 1000000
Threshold rebalancing percent - dot cannot be first character
Threshold rebalancing percent - dot cannot be last character
Threshold rebalancing percent - value cannot be lower than 0.1
Threshold rebalancing percent - up to 3 digits after dot
Validation interval - cannot be lower than 2
Need notifications permission to run rebalancing check
Likely you didn\'t provide the Binance keys.
"Likely or slow network connection or no network at all. "
"Likely Binance removed one of your coins from the exchange. Please validate the records again. "
Please validate records again, it will likely solve the issue.
"Total value of selected coins is less than "
You need to validate records by clicking the button in the main page.
Exception occurred. View exceptions for more details.
Critical Exception occurred. View exceptions for more details.
Indicates that performing rebalance check in background. Required for it to work.
Reached threshold you set you want to rebalance at.
Problem we didn\'t expect to happen.
We will redirect you to app settings. Please enter the notifications section and enable them.
